answers.answer: Hello and hope you are doing well.Stiffening of the ventricles and the resulting abnormal ventricular filling during diastole are referred to as diastolic dysfunction. This occurs due to hypertension, diabetes, coronary artery disease, aortic stenosis and restrictive/hypertrophic cardiomyopathy. So, therapy is aimed at investigating the cause for the dysfunction and treating it. So, discuss with your doctor about ruling out the other causes for this dysfunction.Hope this helped and do keep us posted.

question: 34 yrs old and just told I have diastolic dysfunction ofvyhe left ventricle. I don't understand what it is and what I need to do now. My Dr says to take cholesterol lowering pills. My cholesterol is 125. My blood pressure today is 130/85. I don't smoke. J am overweight and that's the only factors she can find. She says shes unsure of my case because she only sees this in patients 50 yrs and older. What do I do? I'm worried and need answers.
title: 34 yrs old wiyh diastolic dysfunction
